holidays.name: National Mud Pack Day
holidays.description: A day to pamper your skin with the therapeutic benefits of mud packs ‚Äî perfect for a spa day at home or striking up some natural skincare creativity!
holidays.origin: Originally popularized by spa culture and natural remedy enthusiasts looking to promote earth-based beauty treatments.
holidays.funFact: Mud packs can actually help detoxify the skin and improve circulation, making you glow in a naturally muddy way!

holidays.name: National Hot Mulled Cider Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the cozy autumn vibes by sipping warm, spiced apple cider ‚Äî think cinnamon, cloves, and all things nice!
holidays.origin: An old tradition in cooler climates where cider is mulled to add warmth and spice during fall and winter months.
holidays.funFact: Hot mulled cider was a popular holiday drink centuries ago, often served at medieval feasts to fight off the chill.

holidays.name: International Podcast Day
holidays.description: A global celebration of podcast creators and listeners, acknowledging the power of spoken stories and information-sharing through this dynamic medium.
holidays.origin: Established by The Podcast Academy to recognize and support the growing community of podcasters worldwide.
holidays.funFact: There are over 2 million podcasts available today, covering nearly every topic imaginable‚Äîfrom ghost stories to quantum physics!

holidays.name: Ask a Stupid Question Day
holidays.description: Encourages people, especially students, to ask all those quirky, silly, or 'stupid' questions without embarrassment, boosting curiosity and learning.
holidays.origin: Started in American schools during the 1980s to help children feel comfortable engaging and asking questions in class.
holidays.funFact: Many 'stupid' questions lead to brilliant discoveries ‚Äî sometimes curiosity really *does* kill the cat's boredom!
